result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell L. Fair Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darrell L. Fair Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Darrell L. Fair Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 2 years WSP concurrent to 14CF910 & 14CF969; 1 year initial confinement w/credit for 353 days served; 1 year extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 7/24/15 at 11am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz states he has a report from the Dr, requests a short adjournment to attempt to work out a global resolution.  FPT continued to 6/5/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
